adverbs.description: equally (comparative more equally, superlative most equally)

entries.meaning: (manner) In an equal manner; in equal shares or proportion; with equal and impartial justice; evenly
examples: The pie was divided equally among the guests.
They shared equally in the spoils.

entries.meaning: (degree) In equal degree or extent; just as.
examples: The gas stations are equally far from the highway.

entries.meaning: (conjunctive) Used to link two or more coordinate elements
examples: John suffered setbacks at his job. Equally, Frank's business slowed.
